items: Understand what a variable is and why we use it
Learn how to create variables in Python
Recognize basic data types: int, float, str, bool

sections.heading: What is a variable?
paragraphs: A variable is like a box that stores information. It has a name (so you can find it later) and a value (the thing inside the box). You can change what’s inside the box anytime.

sections.heading: Why data types matter
bullets: You can add two ints together (2 + 3 = 5)
You can’t mix types without converting

sections.heading: Try it
bullets: Create variables: your name (str), your age (int)
Create a float for height in meters
Create a bool for whether you like pizza
Print each variable, then change one and print again
Variables store information for your program
Common data types: int, float, str, bool
Variables can be changed after you create them
